description: Structures the response using the Mutually Exclusive, Collectively Exhaustive framework - a principle where categories have no overlaps and cover all possibilities. This decorator ensures comprehensive analysis with clear categorization for decision-making and problem-solving.

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.description: Number of top-level MECE dimensions to use for categorization

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Maximum level of hierarchical breakdown within each dimension

parameters.name: framework
parameters.description: Optional predefined MECE framework to apply

examples.description: Basic MECE analysis of a business problem
examples.usage:
+++MECE
What factors should we consider when expanding to a new market?
examples.result: Organizes market expansion factors into 3 mutually exclusive, collectively exhaustive categories with no overlaps and full coverage of all considerations

examples.description: Detailed MECE framework with stakeholder focus
examples.usage:
+++MECE(dimensions=4, depth=3, framework=stakeholders)
Analyze the implications of implementing a four-day work week.
examples.result: Provides a 4-dimension MECE analysis of a four-day work week using a stakeholder framework, with up to 3 levels of hierarchical breakdown within each stakeholder category
